question:
When in mid-winter a feeble high pressure develops over the North-Western part of India what would be the influence on the weather conditions?
1. High and dry winds would blow outward from this high-pressure region
2. Scorching winds (locally called loo) would blow during the day time
3. The Northern plain would become cold
4. There would be torrential rains brought by thunderstorms
Choose the correct option from the codes given below:
explanation: When in mid-winter a feeble high pressure develops over the North-Western part of India, high and dry winds would blow outward from this high-pressure region and the Northern plain would become cold.
